meanings.definition: The division into two opposing groups or factions.
meanings.sent1: The bipolarization of the class into two teams made the game more exciting.
meanings.sent2: Political debates often highlight the bipolarization of opinions within the country.
meanings.sent3: The family dinner turned into a funny bipolarization of preferences for dessert.
meanings.sent4: The bipolarization of the company's employees created a tense work environment.
meanings.sent5: The bipolarization of the school into science lovers and art enthusiasts was evident during the talent show.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming polarized in two opposite directions.
meanings.sent1: The gradual bipolarization of the magnets caused them to attract each other.
meanings.sent2: The bipolarization of society on certain issues can lead to conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The race between the tortoise and the hare was a humorous bipolarization of speed.
meanings.sent4: The bipolarization of the weather patterns resulted in extreme temperatures.
meanings.sent5: The bipolarization of the market trends made it difficult for investors to predict outcomes.
